comments:
Build F1.

See steps in bug 17208.

Got the following exception doing something concurrently. Doing it concurrently 
is a bug (see bug 17208) but CORE should not fail since it should be thread 
safe.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 271 May 22, 2002 17:19:16.431

Added thread-safety for that particular error.  It was an unsynchronized 
cache object, and multiple concurrent reads could cause that concurrency error.  
Added property store concurrency tests, but the tests are still failing...

Deferring.  I've fixed that particular threading problem, but it's too late for 
a thorough overhaul of property store thread safety before 2.0.

There have been several thread safety bug fixes released since this bug was
entered.  See for example bug 19751 and bug 27272.  We have property store
concurrency tests as part of our automated builds now, and they don't fail. 
We'll assume this is fixed.
